name: Lilium
description: Lilium is a genus of about 100 species of bulbous perennials that come in different shapes and colors. The genus belongs to the family Liliaceae and is native to the northern hemisphere.They are erect perennials with usually narrow leaves and flowers characterized by six petal-like segments (three petals in addition to three sepals) which may form the shape of a trumpet. Most of them are elegant, bright colored and fragrant. Throughout history, Lilium has been a powerful symbol in cultures around the world.
meaning: The genus name comes from the Greek word “leiron”, which was assumed to refer to the white Madonna lily (Lilium candidum).
color_description: Lilies come in a large variety of colors and the most common are white, yellow, orange and red.
